com.epoch.mechanisms

Class MechSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.mechanisms.MechSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChemConstants, MechSynthConstants, FormatConstants, MechConstants, MechErrorConstants

    public final class MechSolver
extends Object
implements MechConstants
    Calculates products of molecules and electron-flow arrows.

        The molecule whose products are to be calculated.

        private transient MDocument doc
        The molecule's document; contains flow arrows.

      • eFlows

        private final transient List<MechFlow> eFlows
        Electron-flow arrows associated with the molecule.

      • allFlowAtoms

        private final transient List<MolAtom> allFlowAtoms
        All atoms of the electron-flow sources and sinks.

      • bondElecCts

        private final transient Map<MolBond,Integer> bondElecCts
        Number of electrons in each bond connecting two atoms, keyed by bonds.

      • initImplicitHcounts

        private transient int[] initImplicitHcounts
        Number of implicit H atoms on each atom in the molecule. Used to assign charges and radicals after electron flows.

      • newBonds

        private final transient List<MolBond> newBonds
        Bonds newly formed by electron-flow arrows.

      • removedBondAtoms

        private final transient List<MolAtom[]> removedBondAtoms
        Atoms of bonds removed by electron-flow arrows.

      • bondsToNewH

        private final transient List<MolBond> bondsToNewH
        Newly added bonds to H to force valence errors where warranted. They need to be located properly if this class is called from the mechanism calculator JSP page.

      • multicenterAttachPts

        private final transient List<MolAtom> multicenterAttachPts
        Attachment points of multiatom groups; they masquerade as atoms.

      • atomsInOddAtomGroupsHavingOddAromBonds

        private final transient List<MolAtom> atomsInOddAtomGroupsHavingOddAromBonds
        Atoms in odd-electron multiatom groups that have an odd number of aromatic bonds. Used to correct bond order in setChargesAndRadicals().

    • Constructor Detail

      • MechSolver

        public MechSolver(String xmlStr)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        xmlStr - MRV representation of the molecules and electron-flow arrows whose products will be calculated

    • Method Detail

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • debugPrintMRV

        private static void debugPrintMRV(Object... msg)

      • getProducts

        public Molecule getProducts()
                     throws MechError,
                            MolFormatException
        Calculates products of molecules and electron-flow arrows.
        Returns:
        the calculated products
        Throws:
        MechError - when something is fundamentally wrong with the products of the electron-flow arrows, e.g., they contain hypervalent atoms or one-electron bonds
        MolFormatException - when the reactants can't be imported into a Molecule

      • getProducts

        public Molecule getProducts(boolean fromJSP)
                     throws MechError,
                            MolFormatException
        Calculates products of molecules and electron-flow arrows.
        Parameters:
        fromJSP - whether the reactants come from the mechanism calculator JSP page; when true, atoms in product may be moved and MechErrors are not thrown
        Returns:
        the calculated products
        Throws:
        MechError - when not called from the mechanism calculator and something is fundamentally wrong with the products of the electron-flow arrows, e.g., they contain hypervalent atoms or one-electron bonds
        MolFormatException - when the reactants can't be imported into a Molecule

      • getDocAndFlows

        private void getDocAndFlows()
                     throws MechError
        Imports the MDocument from the molecule, and extracts the electron-flow arrows therefrom.
        Throws:
        MechError - if a two-electron flow points from an atom to one of its ligands

      • standardizeStereoBonds

        private void standardizeStereoBonds()
        Standardizes the bonds in the molecule to avoid stereochemistry matching problems during and after processing.

      • removeUntouchedMolecules

        private void removeUntouchedMolecules()
        Finds atoms in molecule fragments touched by e-flow arrows, and removes atoms NOT in such molecule fragments. Also stores the atoms of the e-flow arrows for later reference.

      • findMulticenterAtoms

        private void findMulticenterAtoms()
        Finds and stores the multicenter attachment points of the molecule.

      • countElectronsAndImplicitH

        private void countElectronsAndImplicitH()
        Counts and stores the number of electrons currently in each bond, and counts and stores the unshared electrons and implicit H atoms of each atom.

      • moveElectrons

        private void moveElectrons()
                    throws MechError
        Calculates new bond electron counts, makes the new sigma bonds, stores their indices. Note: Bond orders of existing bonds are not changed until later.
        Throws:
        MechError - if an atom has too few valence electrons for the electron-flow arrow originating at it

      • checkNoNegativeUnshared

        private void checkNoNegativeUnshared()
                              throws MechError
        Throws an error if there are any atoms with unshared electrons < 0.
        Throws:
        MechError - if any atoms have a negative number of unshared electrons

      • setBondTypes

        private List<MolBond> setBondTypes(boolean fromJSP)
                            throws MechError
        After electrons are moved, sets new bond types, removes bonds of order 0, and erases stereochemistry of double bonds whose atoms are involved in changing bonds.
        Parameters:
        fromJSP - whether the reactants come from the mechanism calculator JSP page
        Returns:
        list of bonds that have an odd number of electrons
        Throws:
        MechError - if a bond is calculated to have a negative number of electrons

      • setChargesAndRadicals

        private void setChargesAndRadicals()
        Sets charges and radical flags, calculating them from bond orders and unshared electrons.

      • resetHCounts

        private List<MolAtom> resetHCounts(boolean hasOddElectronBond)
        Looks for atoms that lost implicit H atoms, and adds explicit H atoms to replace them; AND adds explicit H atoms to heteroatoms if there's a half-integral bond (heteroatoms and terminal C atoms will not show H atoms in SMARTS); AND checks for atoms with too many outer-shell electrons; AND identifies the part of the molecule ready for 2D clean.
        Parameters:
        hasOddElectronBond - whether a bond in the product has been calculated to have an odd number of electrons
        Returns:
        list of atoms that have too many electrons

      • ungroupUnbondedGroups

        private void ungroupUnbondedGroups()
        Ungroups multiatom groups whose attachment points have been disconnected from the atoms to which they were bonded.

      • cleanCalculatedProduct

        private void cleanCalculatedProduct(boolean hasOddElectronBond)
        Readies the product for display in the mechanism calculator JSP page.
        Parameters:
        hasOddElectronBond - whether a bond in the product has been calculated to have an odd number of electrons

      • lookForInvalidProducts

        private void lookForInvalidProducts(List<MolBond> oddElectronBonds,
                                    List<MolAtom> tooManyElectronAtoms)
                             throws MechError
        Checks for half-integral bond, valence, outer-shell electrons errors.
        Parameters:
        oddElectronBonds - bonds in the product that have been calculated to have an odd number of electrons
        tooManyElectronAtoms - atoms whose calculated number of electrons exceeds the maximum
        Throws:
        MechError - if there's an odd-electron bond, an atom with too many electrons, or a valence error

        arrAtoms - an array of atoms

        private int getSumBondElecCts(MolAtom atom,
                              int atomNum)
        Calculates the total number of electrons in an atom's bonds.
        Parameters:
        atom - an atom
        atomNum - 0-based index of the atom
        Returns:
        twice the sum of the bond orders (corrected for coordinate bonds)

        private void addAtomsInTouchedMols(MolAtom atom,
                                   List<MolAtom> atomsInTouchedMols)

        Parameters:
        atom - the given atom
        atomsInTouchedMols - list of atoms in molecules touched by electron-flow arrows

      • inOddAtomGroupWithAromBond

        private boolean inOddAtomGroupWithAromBond(MolAtom atom)
        Gets whether an atom with an odd number of unshared electrons and an odd number of bond electrons has an aromatic bond to another, and both are in a multiatom group with an odd number of atoms. If so, stores the atom for future reference.
        Parameters:
        atom - the given atom
        Returns:
        true if the atom has an aromatic bond to another, and both are in an odd-atom multiatom group

      • inOddAtomGroup

        private boolean inOddAtomGroup(MolBond bond)
        Gets whether the bond is in an odd-atom multiatom group.
        Parameters:
        bond - a bond
        Returns:
        true if the bond is in an odd-atom multiatom group

      • setBondType

        private void setBondType(MolBond bond,
                         int bondNum,
                         int newBondElecCt,
                         boolean bondIsNew,
                         boolean fromJSP)
        After electrons are moved, sets new type of bond or removes bond if order 0. Also erases stereochemistry of double bonds whose atoms are involved in changing bonds.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond whose order to change
        bondNum - 0-based index of the bond
        newBondElecCt - number of electrons now in the bond
        bondIsNew - whether the bond is a new one
        fromJSP - whether the reactants come from the mechanism calculator JSP page

      • adjustDoubleBondStereo

        private void adjustDoubleBondStereo(MolBond bond,
                                    MolAtom[] bondAtoms,
                                    int bondNum)
        If an atom in the changing bond is participating in an unchanging double bond, and each atom of the double bond has one or two substituents, changes the stereo of that double bond to cis-trans unspecified. Would be better to find out first if it's stereogenic, but changing to wavy unnecessarily won't hurt.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond whose order to change
        bondAtoms - atoms of the bond
        bondNum - 0-based index of the bond

      • inCumulene

        private boolean inCumulene(MolBond bond)
        Determines whether a double bond is part of a cumulene.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond
        Returns:
        true if it is part of a cumulene

      • inCumulene

        private boolean inCumulene(MolBond bond,
                           MolAtom[] bondAtoms)
        Determines whether a double bond is part of a cumulene.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond
        bondAtoms - atoms of the bond
        Returns:
        true if it is part of a cumulene

      • setAtomCharge

        private boolean setAtomCharge(MolAtom atom,
                              int atomNum,
                              int sumBondElecCts,
                              int chargeFlag)
        Calculates and sets the charge of an atom after electrons are moved.
        Parameters:
        atom - an atom
        atomNum - 0-based index of the atom
        sumBondElecCts - twice the sum of the bond orders
        chargeFlag - used to set charge when an atom has an odd-electron bond
        Returns:
        true if the atom has a half-integral bond

      • changeLigandElectrons

        private void changeLigandElectrons(MolAtom mcAtom,
                                   int origUnshared)
        When a bond to a multicenter attachment point is broken, adjusts the ligand atoms accordingly. Even-atom ligands have alternating single and multiple bonds or continuous aromatic bonds and can lose one or two electrons. Odd-atom ligands have continuous aromatic bonds and can become an anion, cation, or radical, which requires converting the aromatic bonds into alternating single and double bonds.
        Parameters:
        mcAtom - a multicenter attachment point
        origUnshared - number of electrons of the multicenter attachment point: -2 or -1 for even-atom ligands, and -2, 0, or +2 for odd-atom ligands

      • dearomatize

        private void dearomatize(Sgroup multiatomGroup)
        Dearomatizes a cyclic, even-atom multiatom group.
        Parameters:
        multiatomGroup - a multiatom group

      • aromaticBondsToSingle

        private void aromaticBondsToSingle(MolAtom grpAtom)
        Converts all of the aromatic bonds of this atom to single bonds.
        Parameters:
        grpAtom - an atom in a multiatom group

      • aromaticBondsToAlternating

        private void aromaticBondsToAlternating(Sgroup multiatomGroup)
        Converts the aromatic bonds in a formerly odd-atom and now even-atom multiatom group into alternating single and double bonds.
        Parameters:
        multiatomGroup - a multiatom group, altered by this method

      • getGroupTerminus

        private MolAtom getGroupTerminus(Sgroup multiatomGroup)
        Gets an atom of the multiatom group that is bound to only one other atom in the multiatom group, preferentially the one that is touched by an electron-flow arrow, or null if the multiatom group is cyclic.
        Parameters:
        multiatomGroup - the multiatom group
        Returns:
        a terminal atom of the multiatom group, or null if group is cyclic

      • setRadicalState

        private void setRadicalState(MolAtom atom,
                             int atomNum,
                             int sumBondElecCts)
        Calculates and sets the radical state of an atom.
        Parameters:
        atom - an atom
        atomNum - index of the atom
        sumBondElecCts - twice the sum of the bond orders

      • addHAtoms

        private void addHAtoms(MolAtom atom,
                       int numToAdd)
        Adds explicit H atoms to an atom.
        Parameters:
        atom - the atom gaining the explicit H atoms
        numToAdd - the number of H atoms being added

      • changeElectronCount

        private void changeElectronCount(MolAtom atom,
                                 int change)
        Changes the number of electrons on an atom.
        Parameters:
        atom - the atom
        change - change in number of electrons (negative for decrease)

      • getNumBondElecs

        private int getNumBondElecs(MolBond bond)
        Gets the number of electrons of a bond, returning 2 if it is coordinate.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond
        Returns:
        the number of electrons in the bond (twice the order)

      • setNumBondElecs

        private void setNumBondElecs(MolBond bond,
                             int numElecs)
        Sets the order of a bond to match the given number of electrons, using AROMATIC for 3 electrons.
        Parameters:
        bond - the bond
        numElecs - the number of electrons in the bond

      • getChemAxonBondConstant

        private int getChemAxonBondConstant(int bondElecCt)
        Converts twice the bond order to bond type. Called by setBondType().
        Parameters:
        bondElecCt - twice the calculated bond order; should be 2, 4, or 6, but may be 1, 3, or 5
        Returns:
        the bond order (half the value) for even values; nonstandard query bond type for odd values

      • getChemAxonRadicalConstant

        private AtomProperty.Radical getChemAxonRadicalConstant(int electrons)
        Gets a ChemAxon radical constant corresponding to a number of unshared electrons of an electron-deficient atom. Called by setRadicalState().
        Parameters:
        electrons - number of electrons
        Returns:
        a ChemAxon radical constant

      • moveToGap

        private void moveToGap(MolAtom fixedAtom,
                       MolAtom moveAtom)
        Finds if an atom is too close to the other ligands of a fixed atom; if so, moves it into a bigger gap in the ligand sphere.
        Parameters:
        fixedAtom - the fixed atom
        moveAtom - the atom that may be moved; must be a ligand of the fixed atom

      • getRotation

        private double getRotation(MolAtom fixedAtom,
                           MolAtom moveAtom,
                           double[] anglesToLigs)
        Gets the optimum angle of rotation to put a ligand of a fixed atom as far as possible from other atoms in the ligand sphere.
        Parameters:
        fixedAtom - the fixed atom
        moveAtom - the atom being moved
        anglesToLigs - array of angles of moveAtom to other ligands of fixedAtom
        Returns:
        the optimal angle, in radians
